select_type.description: Type of select used in the table.

SIMPLE.message: A simple query without subqueries or unions.

type.description: Join used in the query for a specific table.

system.message: Table has zero or one row, no change required.

const.message: Table has only one indexed matching row, fastest join type.

eq_ref.message: All index parts used in join and index is primary_key or unique not null.

ref.message: All matching rows of an indexed column read for each combination of rows from previous table.
ref.suggestion:
Ensure the referenced column is indexed and look for null values, dupilcates. Upgrade to eq_ref join type if possible.
You can acheive eq_ref by adding unique and not null to the index - $key used in $table table table.

fulltext.message: Join uses table FULLTEXT index, index key used - $key.
fulltext.suggestion: Should only be used for text heavy columns.

ref_or_null.message: Using ref index with Null value in $table table.
ref_or_null.suggestion: Please check if you can upgrade to eq_ref, you can acheive eq_ref by adding unique and not null to the index - $key used in $table table.

index_merge.message: Join uses list of indexes, keys used: $key.
index_merge.suggestion: Slow if the indexes are not well-chosen or if there are too many indexes being used.

range.message: Index used to find matching rows in specific range.
range.suggestion: Please check the range it should not be too broad.

index.message: Entire index tree scanned to find matching rows.
index.suggestion: Can be slow for large indexes(Your key length: $key_len), use carefully.

ALL.message: Entire $table table is scanned to find matching rows, you have $amount_possible_keys possible keys to use.
ALL.suggestion: Use index here. You can use index from possible key: $possible_keys or add new one to $table table as per the requirements.

rows.description: Estimated number of rows scanned to find matching rows.

threshold.message: $value rows are being scanned per join for $table table.
threshold.suggestion: Please see if it is possible to use index from $possible_keys or add new one to $table table as per the requirements to reduce the number of rows scanned.

possible_keys.description: Index keys possible for a specifc table

absent.message: There are no possible keys for $table table to be used, can result into full scan
absent.suggestion: Please add index keys for $table table

threshold.message: There are $amount possible keys for $table table, having too many index keys can be unoptimal
threshold.suggestion: Please check if there are extra indexes in $table table.

absent.message: There is no index key used for $table table, and can result into full scan of the $table table
absent.suggestion: Please use index from possible_keys: $possible_keys or add new one to $table table as per the requirements.

key_len.description: Length of the key index used

filtered.description: Indicates percentage of rows appearing from the total.

Using filesort.message: A file-based algorithm in being applied over your result, This can be inefficient and result into long query time.
Using filesort.suggestion: Please ensure either result set is small or use proper index.

threshold.message: You have selected $amount columns, You should not select too many columns.
The cardinality of table is $amount, and its too high.
threshold.suggestion: Please use proper index, query only requried data and ensure you are using proper joins.
